YAHOO.widget.Dialog.name: YAHOO.widget.Dialog

buttons.description: Object literal(s) defining the buttons for the Dialog's footer.

postmethod.description: The method to use for posting the Dialog's form. Possible values are "async", "form", and "manual".

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Dialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Dialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Dialog. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: Dialog is an implementation of Panel that can be used to submit form data. Built-in functionality for buttons with event handlers is included, and button sets can be build dynamically, or the preincluded ones for Submit/Cancel and OK/Cancel can be utilized. Forms can be processed in 3 ways -- via an asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form POST or GET, or manually.

asyncSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to asynchronous submission

manualSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to manual submission

formSubmitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to form-based submission

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configButtons.description: The default event handler for the "buttons" configuration property

focusFirstButton.description: Sets the focus to the first button in the button list

doSubmit.description: Performs the submission of the Dialog form depending on the value of "postmethod" property.

initEvents.description: Initializes the custom events for Dialog which are fired automatically at appropriate times by the Dialog class.

focusFirst.description: The default event handler used to focus the first field of the form when the Dialog is shown.

focusLastButton.description: Sets the focus to the first button in the button list

submit.description: Executes a submit of the Dialog followed by a hide, if validation is successful.

focusLast.description: Sets the focus to the last button in the button or form element in the Dialog

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Dialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Dialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Dialog. See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description: The Dialog initialization method, which is executed for Dialog and all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

return.description: The string representation of the Dialog

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

cancel.description: Executes the cancel of the Dialog followed by a hide.

focusDefaultButton.description: Sets the focus to the button that is designated as the default. By default, his handler is executed when the show event is fired.

validate.description: Built-in function hook for writing a validation function that will be checked for a "true" value prior to a submit. This function, as implemented by default, always returns true, so it should be overridden if validation is necessary.

return.description: A JSON object reprsenting the data of the current form.

getData.description: Returns a JSON-compatible data structure representing the data currently contained in the form.

registerForm.description: Prepares the Dialog's internal FORM object, creating one if one is not currently present.

initDefaultConfig.description: Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be changed using the Dialog's Config object (cfg).

YAHOO.widget.Dialog.CSS_DIALOG.description: Constant representing the default CSS class used for a Dialog

callback.description: The internally maintained callback object for use with the Connection utility

callback.failure.description: The function to execute upon failure of the Connection submission

callback.success.description: The function to execute upon success of the Connection submission

callback.argument.description: The arbitraty argument or arguments to pass to the Connection callback functions

YAHOO.widget.Dialog.description: Dialog is an implementation of Panel that can be used to submit form data. Built-in functionality for buttons with event handlers is included, and button sets can be build dynamically, or the preincluded ones for Submit/Cancel and OK/Cancel can be utilized. Forms can be processed in 3 ways -- via an asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form POST or GET, or manually.

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.name: YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog

text.description: Sets the text for the SimpleDialog

icon.description: Sets the informational icon for the SimpleDialog

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the SimpleDialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the SimpleDialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this SimpleDialog. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: SimpleDialog is a simple implementation of Dialog that can be used to submit a single value. Forms can be processed in 3 ways -- via an asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form POST or GET, or manually.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configIcon.description: Fired when the "icon" property is set.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the SimpleDialog OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the SimpleDialog

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this SimpleDialog. See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description: The SimpleDialog initialization method, which is executed for SimpleDialog and all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

return.description: The string representation of the SimpleDialog

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configText.description: Fired when the "text" property is set.

registerForm.description: Prepares the SimpleDialog's internal FORM object, creating one if one is not currently present, and adding the value hidden field.

initDefaultConfig.description: Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be changed using the SimpleDialog's Config object (cfg).

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.CSS_SIMPLEDIAL.description: Constant representing the default CSS class used for a SimpleDialog

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.ICON_INFO.description: Constant for the standard network icon for info

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.ICON_BLOCK.description: Constant for the standard network icon for a blocking action

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.ICON_WARN.description: Constant for the standard network icon for warn

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.ICON_ALARM.description: Constant for the standard network icon for alarm

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.ICON_TIP.description: Constant for the standard network icon for a tip

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.ICON_HELP.description: Constant for the standard network icon for help

YAHOO.widget.SimpleDialog.description: SimpleDialog is a simple implementation of Dialog that can be used to submit a single value. Forms can be processed in 3 ways -- via an asynchronous Connection utility call, a simple form POST or GET, or manually.

YAHOO.widget.Panel.name: YAHOO.widget.Panel

draggable.description: True if the Panel should be draggable

close.description: True if the Panel should display a "close" button

keylisteners.description: A KeyListener (or array of KeyListeners) that will be enabled when the Panel is shown, and disabled when the Panel is hidden.

underlay.description: Sets the type of underlay to display for the Panel. Valid values are "shadow", "matte", and "none".

modal.description: True if the Panel should be displayed in a modal fashion, automatically creating a transparent mask over the document that will not be removed until the Panel is dismissed.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Panel OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Panel

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Panel. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: Panel is an implementation of Overlay that behaves like an OS window, with a draggable header and an optional close icon at the top right.

showMaskEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the modality mask is shown

dragEvent.description: CustomEvent when the Panel is dragged

hideMaskEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the modality mask is hidden

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configClose.description: The default event handler fired when the "close" property is changed. The method controls the appending or hiding of the close icon at the top right of the Panel.

return.description: Success or failure of the render

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element id to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering OR

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering

render.description: Renders the Panel by inserting the elements that are not already in the main Panel into their correct places. Optionally appends the Panel to the specified node prior to the render's execution. NOTE: For Panels without existing markup, the appendToNode argument is REQUIRED. If this argument is ommitted and the current element is not present in the document, the function will return false, indicating that the render was a failure.

initEvents.description: Initializes the custom events for Module which are fired automatically at appropriate times by the Module class.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configModal.description: The default event handler fired when the "modal" property is changed. This handler subscribes or unsubscribes to the show and hide events to handle the display or hide of the modality mask.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configKeyListeners.description: The default event handler fired when the "keylisteners" property is changed.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Overlay OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Overlay

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Overlay. See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description: The Overlay initialization method, which is executed for Overlay and all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

return.description: The string representation of the Panel.

toString.description: Returns a String representation of the object.

buildWrapper.description: Builds the wrapping container around the Panel that is used for positioning the shadow and matte underlays. The container element is assigned to a  local instance variable called container, and the element is reinserted inside of it.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configHeight.description: The default event handler fired when the "height" property is changed.

params.name: e
params.description: The resize DOM event

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object

onDomResize.description: Event handler fired when the resize monitor element is resized.

registerDragDrop.description: Registers the Panel's header for drag & drop capability.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configUnderlay.description: The default event handler fired when the "underlay" property is changed.

buildMask.description: Builds the mask that is laid over the document when the Panel is configured to be modal.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configWidth.description: The default event handler fired when the "width" property is changed.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configDraggable.description: The default event handler fired when the "draggable" property is changed.

sizeMask.description: Sets the size of the modality mask to cover the entire scrollable area of the document

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configzIndex.description: The default event handler fired when the "zIndex" property is changed.

sizeUnderlay.description: Adjusts the size of the shadow based on the size of the element.

initDefaultConfig.description: Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be changed using the Panel's Config object (cfg).

YAHOO.widget.Panel.CSS_PANEL_CONTAINER.description: Constant representing the default CSS class used for a Panel's wrapping container

YAHOO.widget.Panel.CSS_PANEL.description: Constant representing the default CSS class used for a Panel

YAHOO.widget.Panel.description: Panel is an implementation of Overlay that behaves like an OS window, with a draggable header and an optional close icon at the top right.

YAHOO.util.KeyListener.name: YAHOO.util.KeyListener

params.name: attachTo
params.description: The element or element ID to which the key event should be attached

params.name: attachTo
params.description: The element or element ID to which the key event should be attached

params.name: keyData
params.description: The object literal representing the key(s) to detect. Possible attributes are shift(boolean), alt(boolean), ctrl(boolean) and keys(either an int or an array of ints representing keycodes).

params.name: handler
params.description: The CustomEvent handler to fire when the key event is detected

params.name: handler
params.description: An object literal representing the handler.

params.name: event
params.description: Optional. The event (keydown or keyup) to listen for. Defaults automatically to keydown.

constructors.description: KeyListener is a utility that provides an easy interface for listening for keydown/keyup events fired against DOM elements.

enabled.description: Boolean indicating the enabled/disabled state of the Tooltip

params.name: e
params.description: The keypress DOM event

params.name: obj
params.description: The DOM event scope object

handleKeyPress.description: Handles the key event when a key is pressed.

enable.description: Enables the KeyListener by attaching the DOM event listeners to the target DOM element

return.description: The string representation of the KeyListener

toString.description: Returns a String representation of the object.

disable.description: Disables the KeyListener by removing the DOM event listeners from the target DOM element

params.name: keyData
params.description: The object literal representing the key(s) to detect. Possible attributes are shift(boolean), alt(boolean), ctrl(boolean) and keys(either an int or an array of ints representing keycodes).

enabledEvent.description: The CustomEvent fired when the KeyListener is enabled via the enable() function

params.name: keyData
params.description: The object literal representing the key(s) to detect. Possible attributes are shift(boolean), alt(boolean), ctrl(boolean) and keys(either an int or an array of ints representing keycodes).

disabledEvent.description: The CustomEvent fired when the KeyListener is disabled via the disable() function

params.name: keyData
params.description: The object literal representing the key(s) to detect. Possible attributes are shift(boolean), alt(boolean), ctrl(boolean) and keys(either an int or an array of ints representing keycodes).

keyEvent.description: The CustomEvent fired internally when a key is pressed

YAHOO.util.KeyListener.description: KeyListener is a utility that provides an easy interface for listening for keydown/keyup events fired against DOM elements.

YAHOO.widget.OverlayManager.name: YAHOO.widget.OverlayManager

focusevent.description: The default DOM event that should be used to focus an Overlay

overlays.description: The collection of registered Overlays in use by the OverlayManager

params.name: overlays
params.description: Optional. A collection of Overlays to register with the manager.

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The object literal representing the user configuration of the OverlayManager

constructors.description: OverlayManager is used for maintaining the focus status of multiple Overlays.* @namespace YAHOO.widget

hideAll.description: Hides all Overlays in the manager.

blurAll.description: Removes focus from all registered Overlays in the manager

return.description: True if any Overlays are registered.

params.name: overlay
params.description: An Overlay to register with the manager.

params.name: overlay
params.description: An array of Overlays to register with the manager.

register.description: Registers an Overlay or an array of Overlays with the manager. Upon registration, the Overlay receives functions for focus and blur, along with CustomEvents for each.

params.name: overlay
params.description: The Overlay to focus

params.name: overlay
params.description: The id of the Overlay to focus

params.name: overlay
params.description: The Overlay to remove

params.name: overlay
params.description: The id of the Overlay to remove

remove.description: Removes the specified Overlay from the manager

return.description: 0, 1, or -1, depending on where the Overlay should fall in the stacking order.

compareZIndexDesc.description: Used for sorting the manager's Overlays by z-index.

params.name: overlays
params.description: Optional. A collection of Overlays to register with the manager.

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The object literal representing the user configuration of the OverlayManager

return.description: The currently focused Overlay
The string representation of the OverlayManager

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

showAll.description: Shows all Overlays in the manager.

return.description: The requested Overlay, if found, or null if it cannot be located.

params.name: overlay
params.description: An Overlay to locate within the manager

params.name: overlay
params.description: An Overlay id to locate within the manager

find.description: Attempts to locate an Overlay by instance or ID.

initDefaultConfig.description: Initializes the default configuration of the OverlayManager

cfg.description: The OverlayManager's Config object used for monitoring configuration properties.

YAHOO.widget.OverlayManager.CSS_FOCUSED.description: The CSS class representing a focused Overlay

overlays.description: The array of Overlays that are currently registered

YAHOO.widget.OverlayManager.description: OverlayManager is used for maintaining the focus status of multiple Overlays.* @namespace YAHOO.widget

YAHOO.util.Config.name: YAHOO.util.Config

params.name: owner
params.description: The owner Object to which this Config Object belongs

constructors.description: Config is a utility used within an Object to allow the implementer to maintain a list of local configuration properties and listen for changes to those properties dynamically using CustomEvent. The initial values are also maintained so that the configuration can be reset at any given point to its initial state.

configChangedEvent.description: Object reference to the owner of this Config Object

fireQueue.description: Fires the normalized list of queued property change events

return.description: true, if the function/Object pair is already subscribed to the CustomEvent passed in

YAHOO.util.Config.alreadySubscribed.description: Checks to determine if a particular function/Object pair are already subscribed to the specified CustomEvent

params.name: evt
params.description: The CustomEvent for which to check the subscriptions

params.name: fn
params.description: The function to look for in the subscribers list

params.name: obj
params.description: The execution scope Object for the subscription

return.description: The value of the specified property

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

getProperty.description: Returns the value of specified property.

params.name: key
params.description: The configuration property's name

params.name: propertyObject
params.description: The Object containing all of this property's arguments

addProperty.description: Adds a property to the Config Object's private config hash.

return.description: true, if the set was successful, false if it failed.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the property to

queueProperty.description:
Sets the value of a property and queues its event to execute. If the event is already scheduled to execute, it is
moved from its current position to the end of the queue.

return.description: true, if the value is valid

params.name: val
params.description: The value to validate

checkNumber.description: Validates that the value passed in is a number.

return.description: The string list of CustomEvents currently queued for execution

outputEventQueue.description: Returns a string representation of the Config object's current CustomEvent queue

return.description: True is the property was reset, false if not

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

resetProperty.description: Resets the specified property's value to its initial value.

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration Object literal

params.name: init
params.description: When set to true, the initialConfig will be set to the userConfig passed in, so that calling a reset will reset the properties to the passed values.

applyConfig.description:
Applies a key-value Object literal to the configuration, replacing any existing values, and queueing the property events.
Although the values will be set, fireQueue() must be called for their associated events to execute.

refresh.description: Refires the events for all configuration properties using their current values.

return.description: True, if the subscription was successful, otherwise false.

params.name: key
params.description: The property name

params.name: handler
params.description: The handler function to use subscribe to the property's event

params.name: obj
params.description: The Object to use for scoping the event handler (see CustomEvent documentation)

params.name: override
params.description: Optional. If true, will override "this" within the handler to map to the scope Object passed into the method.

subscribeToConfigEvent.description: Subscribes an external handler to the change event for any given property.

return.description: true, if the value is valid

params.name: val
params.description: The value to validate

checkBoolean.description: Validates that the value passed in is a Boolean.

params.name: owner
params.description: The owner Object to which this Config Object belongs

init.description: Initializes the configuration Object and all of its local members.

return.description: The Config object in string format.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the Config object

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

refireEvent.description: Fires the event for a property using the property's current value.

return.description: The current config, represented in a key-value map

getConfig.description: Returns a key-value configuration map of the values currently set in the Config Object.

return.description: True, if the set was successful, false if it failed.

params.name: key
params.description: The name of the property

params.name: value
params.description: The value to set the property to

params.name: silent
params.description: Whether the value should be set silently, without firing the property event.

setProperty.description: Sets the value of a property. If the silent property is passed as true, the property's event will not be fired.

params.name: key
params.description: The configuration property's name

params.name: Object
params.description: The value of the correct type for the property

fireEvent.description: Fires a configuration property event using the specified value.

return.description: True, if the unsubscription was successful, otherwise false.

params.name: key
params.description: The property name

params.name: handler
params.description: The handler function to use subscribe to the property's event

params.name: obj
params.description: The Object to use for scoping the event handler (see CustomEvent documentation)

unsubscribeFromConfigEvent.description: Unsubscribes an external handler from the change event for any given property.

owner.description: Object reference to the owner of this Config Object

queueInProgress.description: Boolean flag that specifies whether a queue is currently being executed

initialConfig.description:
Maintains the local collection of configuration property objects as they were initially applied.
This object is used when resetting a property.

config.description: Maintains the local collection of configuration property objects and their specified values

eventQueue.description: Maintains the local, normalized CustomEvent queue

YAHOO.util.Config.description: Config is a utility used within an Object to allow the implementer to maintain a list of local configuration properties and listen for changes to those properties dynamically using CustomEvent. The initial values are also maintained so that the configuration can be reset at any given point to its initial state.

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.name: YAHOO.widget.Overlay

iframe.default: true for IE6 and below, false for all others
iframe.description: True if the Overlay should have an IFRAME shim (for correcting the select z-index bug in IE6 and below).

constraintoviewport.description: True if the Overlay should be prevented from being positioned out of the viewport.

xy.description: An array with the absolute x and y positions of the Overlay

context.description: The array of context arguments for context-sensitive positioning. The format is: [id or element, element corner, context corner]. For example, setting this property to ["img1", "tl", "bl"] would align the Overlay's top left corner to the context element's bottom left corner.

y.description: The absolute y-coordinate position of the Overlay

x.description: The absolute x-coordinate position of the Overlay

fixedcenter.description: True if the Overlay should be anchored to the center of the viewport.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Overlay OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Overlay

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing 10/23/2006the configuration that should be set for this Overlay. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: Overlay is a Module that is absolutely positioned above the page flow. It has convenience methods for positioning and sizing, as well as options for controlling zIndex and constraining the Overlay's position to the current visible viewport. Overlay also contains a dynamicly generated IFRAME which is placed beneath it for Internet Explorer 6 and 5.x so that it will be properly rendered above SELECT elements.

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.windowScrollEvent.description: A singleton CustomEvent used for reacting to the DOM event for window scroll

params.name: x
params.description: x coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: y coordinate

moveEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Overlay is moved.

params.name: x
params.description: x coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: y coordinate

beforeMoveEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Overlay is moved.

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.windowResizeEvent.description: A singleton CustomEvent used for reacting to the DOM event for window resize

params.name: x
params.description: The Overlay's new x position

params.name: y
params.description: The Overlay's new y position

moveTo.description: Moves the Overlay to the specified position. This function is identical to calling this.cfg.setProperty("xy", [x,y]);

showIframe.description: Shows the iframe shim, if it has been enabled

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configFixedCenter.description: The default event handler fired when the "fixedcenter" property is changed.

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM resize event

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.windowResizeHandler.description: The DOM event handler used to fire the CustomEvent for window resize

showMacGeckoScrollbars.description:
Removes a special CSS class from the Overlay when Mac/Gecko is in use, to work around a Gecko bug where
scrollbars cannot be hidden. See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=187435

hideMacGeckoScrollbars.description:
Adds a special CSS class to the Overlay when Mac/Gecko is in use, to work around a Gecko bug where
scrollbars cannot be hidden. See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=187435

initEvents.description: Initializes the custom events for Overlay which are fired automatically at appropriate times by the Overlay class.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Overlay OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Overlay

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Overlay. See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description: The Overlay initialization method, which is executed for Overlay and all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configXY.description: The default event handler fired when the "xy" property is changed.

return.description: The string representation of the Overlay.

toString.description: Returns a String representation of the object.

syncPosition.description: Synchronizes the Panel's "xy", "x", and "y" properties with the Panel's position in the DOM. This is primarily used to update position information during drag & drop.

hideIframe.description: Hides the iframe shim, if it has been enabled

align.description: Aligns the Overlay to its context element using the specified corner points (represented by the constants TOP_LEFT, TOP_RIGHT, BOTTOM_LEFT, and BOTTOM_RIGHT.

YAHOO.widget.Overlay._initialized.description: A boolean that indicated whether the window resize and scroll events have already been subscribed to.

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.CSS_OVERLAY.description: Constant representing the default CSS class used for an Overlay

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.BOTTOM_RIGHT.description: Constant representing the bottom right corner of an element, used for configuring the context element alignment

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.BOTTOM_LEFT.description: Constant representing the top bottom left corner of an element, used for configuring the context element alignment

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.TOP_RIGHT.description: Constant representing the top right corner of an element, used for configuring the context element alignment

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.TOP_LEFT.description: Constant representing the top left corner of an element, used for configuring the context element alignment

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.IFRAME_SRC.description: The URL that will be placed in the iframe

YAHOO.widget.Overlay.description: Overlay is a Module that is absolutely positioned above the page flow. It has convenience methods for positioning and sizing, as well as options for controlling zIndex and constraining the Overlay's position to the current visible viewport. Overlay also contains a dynamicly generated IFRAME which is placed beneath it for Internet Explorer 6 and 5.x so that it will be properly rendered above SELECT elements.

YAHOO.widget.ContainerEffect.name: YAHOO.widget.ContainerEffect

params.name: overlay
params.description: The Overlay that the animation should be associated with

params.name: attrIn
params.description: The object literal representing the animation arguments to be used for the animate-in transition. The arguments for this literal are: attributes(object, see YAHOO.util.Anim for description), duration(Number), and method(i.e. YAHOO.util.Easing.easeIn).

params.name: attrOut
params.description: The object literal representing the animation arguments to be used for the animate-out transition. The arguments for this literal are: attributes(object, see YAHOO.util.Anim for description), duration(Number), and method(i.e. YAHOO.util.Easing.easeIn).

params.name: targetElement
params.description: Optional. The target element that should be animated during the transition. Defaults to overlay.element.

params.name: Optional.
params.description: The animation class to instantiate. Defaults to YAHOO.util.Anim. Other options include YAHOO.util.Motion.

constructors.description: ContainerEffect encapsulates animation transitions that are executed when an Overlay is shown or hidden.

YAHOO.widget.ContainerEffect.description: ContainerEffect encapsulates animation transitions that are executed when an Overlay is shown or hidden.

YAHOO.widget.Module.name: YAHOO.widget.Module

visible.description: Specifies whether the Module is visible on the page.

monitorresize.description: Specifies whether to create a special proxy iframe to monitor for user font resizing in the document

effect.description: Object or array of objects representing the ContainerEffect classes that are active for animating the container.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Module OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Module

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration Object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this module. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: Module is a JavaScript representation of the Standard Module Format. Standard Module Format is a simple standard for markup containers where child nodes representing the header, body, and footer of the content are denoted using the CSS classes "hd", "bd", and "ft" respectively. Module is the base class for all other classes in the YUI Container package.

params.name: classRef
params.description: class reference of the initializing class, such as this.beforeInitEvent.fire(YAHOO.widget.Module)

hideEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is hidden

beforeHideEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is hidden

params.name: content
params.description: String/element representing the new body content

changeBodyEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the body content of the Module is modified

beforeRenderEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is rendered

changeContentEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the content of the Module is modified

beforeShowEvent.description: CustomEvent fired before the Module is shown

params.name: content
params.description: String/element representing the new footer content

changeFooterEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the footer content of the Module is modified

renderEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is rendered

showEvent.description: CustomEvent fired after the Module is shown

params.name: classRef
params.description: class reference of the initializing class, such as this.beforeInitEvent.fire(YAHOO.widget.Module)

beforeInitEvent.description: CustomEvent fired prior to class initalization.

appendEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the Module is appended to the DOM

params.name: content
params.description: String/element representing the new header content

changeHeaderEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the header content of the Module is modified

destroyEvent.description: CustomEvent fired when the Module is destroyed

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configMonitorResize.description: Default event handler for the "monitorresize" configuration property

params.name: element
params.description: The element to append to the header

appendToHeader.description: Appends the passed element to the header. If no header is present, one will be automatically created.

params.name: bodyContent
params.description: The HTML used to set the body OR

params.name: bodyContent
params.description: The HTMLElement to append to the body

setBody.description: Sets the Module's body content to the HTML specified, or appends the passed element to the body. If no body is present, one will be automatically created.

hide.description: Hides the Module element by setting the visible configuration property to false. Also fires two events: beforeHideEvent prior to the visibility change, and hideEvent after.

return.description: Success or failure of the render

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element id to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering OR

params.name: appendToNode
params.description: The element to which the Module should be appended to prior to rendering

params.name: moduleElement
params.description: OPTIONAL. The element that represents the actual Standard Module container.

render.description: Renders the Module by inserting the elements that are not already in the main Module into their correct places. Optionally appends the Module to the specified node prior to the render's execution. NOTE: For Modules without existing markup, the appendToNode argument is REQUIRED. If this argument is ommitted and the current element is not present in the document, the function will return false, indicating that the render was a failure.

params.name: e
params.description: The DOM resize event

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object passed to the handler

onDomResize.description: Event handler fired when the resize monitor element is resized.

initEvents.description: Initializes the custom events for Module which are fired automatically at appropriate times by the Module class.

params.name: footerContent
params.description: The HTML used to set the footer OR

params.name: footerContent
params.description: The HTMLElement to append to the footer

setFooter.description: Sets the Module's footer content to the HTML specified, or appends the passed element to the footer. If no footer is present, one will be automatically created.

initResizeMonitor.description: Initialized an empty IFRAME that is placed out of the visible area that can be used to detect text resize.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to append to the body

appendToBody.description: Appends the passed element to the body. If no body is present, one will be automatically created.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to append to the footer

appendToFooter.description: Appends the passed element to the footer. If no footer is present, one will be automatically created.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configVisible.description:
Default event handler for changing the visibility property of a Module. By default, this is achieved by switching the "display" style between "block" and "none".
This method is responsible for firing showEvent and hideEvent.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Module OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Module

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration Object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this module. See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description: The Module class's initialization method, which is executed for Module and all of its subclasses. This method is automatically called by the constructor, and  sets up all DOM references for pre-existing markup, and creates required markup if it is not already present.

return.description: The string representation of the Module

toString.description: Returns a String representation of the Object.

initDefaultConfig.description: Initializes the custom events for Module which are fired automatically at appropriate times by the Module class.

show.description: Shows the Module element by setting the visible configuration property to true. Also fires two events: beforeShowEvent prior to the visibility change, and showEvent after.

destroy.description: Removes the Module element from the DOM and sets all child elements to null.

params.name: headerContent
params.description: The HTML used to set the header OR

params.name: headerContent
params.description: The HTMLElement to append to the header

setHeader.description: Sets the Module's header content to the HTML specified, or appends the passed element to the header. If no header is present, one will be automatically created.

body.description: The body element, denoted with CSS class "bd"

isSecure.description: Boolean representing whether or not the current browsing context is secure (https)

YAHOO.widget.Module.CSS_MODULE.description: Constant for the default CSS class name that represents a Module

platform.description: String representing the current user-agent platform

element.description: The main module element that contains the header, body, and footer

YAHOO.widget.Module.RESIZE_MONITOR_SECUR.description: Constant representing the url for the "src" attribute of the iframe used to monitor changes to the browser's base font size

header.description: The header element, denoted with CSS class "hd"

YAHOO.widget.Module.IMG_ROOT.description: Constant representing the prefix path to use for non-secure images

imageRoot.description: The String representing the image root

cfg.description: The Module's Config object used for monitoring configuration properties.

footer.description: The footer element, denoted with CSS class "ft"

YAHOO.widget.Module.IMG_ROOT_SSL.description: Constant representing the prefix path to use for securely served images

browser.description: String representing the current user-agent browser

YAHOO.widget.Module.description: Module is a JavaScript representation of the Standard Module Format. Standard Module Format is a simple standard for markup containers where child nodes representing the header, body, and footer of the content are denoted using the CSS classes "hd", "bd", and "ft" respectively. Module is the base class for all other classes in the YUI Container package.

YAHOO.widget.Tooltip.name: YAHOO.widget.Tooltip

container.description: Specifies the container element that the Tooltip's markup should be rendered into.

showdelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before showing a Tooltip on mouseover.

preventoverlap.description: Specifies whether the Tooltip should be kept from overlapping its context element.

context.description: Specifies the element or elements that the Tooltip should be anchored to on mouseover.

autodismissdelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before automatically dismissing a Tooltip after the mouse has been resting on the context element.

hidedelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before hiding a Tooltip on mouseover.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Tooltip OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Tooltip

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Overlay. See configuration documentation for more details.

constructors.description: Tooltip is an implementation of Overlay that behaves like an OS tooltip, displaying when the user mouses over a particular element, and disappearing on mouse out.

initDefaultConfig.description: Initializes the class's configurable properties which can be changed using the Overlay's Config object (cfg).

return.description: The process ID of the timeout function associated with doShow

params.name: e
params.description: The current DOM event

doShow.description: Processes the showing of the Tooltip by setting the timeout delay and offset of the Tooltip.

params.name: e
params.description: The current DOM event

params.name: obj
params.description: The object argument

onContextMouseOver.description: The default event handler fired when the user mouses over the context element.

doHide.description: Sets the timeout for the auto-dismiss delay, which by default is 5 seconds, meaning that a tooltip will automatically dismiss itself after 5 seconds of being displayed.

params.name: e
params.description: The current DOM event

params.name: obj
params.description: The object argument

onContextMouseOut.description: The default event handler fired when the user mouses out of the context element.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configContainer.description: The default event handler fired when the "container" property is changed.

params.name: el
params.description: The element ID representing the Tooltip OR

params.name: el
params.description: The element representing the Tooltip

params.name: userConfig
params.description: The configuration object literal containing the configuration that should be set for this Tooltip. See configuration documentation for more details.

init.description: The Tooltip initialization method. This method is automatically called by the constructor. A Tooltip is automatically rendered by the init method, and it also is set to be invisible by default, and constrained to viewport by default as well.

params.name: e
params.description: The current DOM event

params.name: obj
params.description: The object argument

onContextMouseMove.description: The default event handler fired when the user moves the mouse while over the context element.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configText.description: The default event handler fired when the "text" property is changed.

params.name: pageX
params.description: The x coordinate position of the mouse pointer

params.name: pageY
params.description: The y coordinate position of the mouse pointer

preventOverlay.description: Fired when the Tooltip is moved, this event handler is used to prevent the Tooltip from overlapping with its context element.

return.description: The string representation of the Tooltip

toString.description: Returns a string representation of the object.

params.name: type
params.description: The CustomEvent type (usually the property name)

params.name: args
params.description: The CustomEvent arguments. For configuration handlers, args[0] will equal the newly applied value for the property.

params.name: obj
params.description: The scope object. For configuration handlers, this will usually equal the owner.

configContext.description: The default event handler fired when the "context" property is changed.

YAHOO.widget.Tooltip.CSS_TOOLTIP.description: Constant representing the Tooltip CSS class

showProcId.description: The unique process ID associated with the thread responsible for showing the Tooltip.

YAHOO.widget.Tooltip.description: Tooltip is an implementation of Overlay that behaves like an OS tooltip, displaying when the user mouses over a particular element, and disappearing on mouse out.

container.name: container
container.title: Container
container.description: The Container family of components is designed to enable developers to create different kinds of content-containing modules on the web. Module and Overlay are the most basic containers, and they can be used directly or extended to build custom containers. Also part of the Container family are four UI controls that extend Module and Overlay: Tooltip, Panel, Dialog, and SimpleDialog.
